Default Inference
http://www.theonering.net/torwp/2015/05/16/98212-one-does-not-simply-fly-into-mordor/: ond reason why the Eagles would not have been a particularly good choice is that the birds coul
The Ring couldn’t be dropped just anywhere; it had to be put in the Crack of Doom itself, which was not out in the open but at the end of a tunnel into which an Eagle probably could not have fit.

http://www.theonering.net/torwp/2015/05/16/98212-one-does-not-simply-fly-into-mordor/: The Ring couldn’t be dropped just anywhere; it had to be put in the Crack of Doom itself, which was not out in the open but at the end of a tunnel into which an Eagle probably could not have fit.
Default Inference
prevents flying high enough to be hidden by clouds
http://www.theonering.net/torwp/2015/05/16/98212-one-does-not-simply-fly-into-mordor/: prevents flying high enough to be hidden by clouds
to ensure that the rider can breathe
http://www.theonering.net/torwp/2015/05/16/98212-one-does-not-simply-fly-into-mordor/: to ensure that the rider can breathe
Cause To Effect
would have crippled the Eagle during any possible fights it might have
http://www.theonering.net/torwp/2015/05/16/98212-one-does-not-simply-fly-into-mordor/: would have crippled the Eagle during any possible fights it might have
Negative Consequences
A few people could sneak up the mountain with much less chance of observation.
http://www.theonering.net/torwp/2015/05/16/98212-one-does-not-simply-fly-into-mordor/: A few people could sneak up the mountain with much less chance of observation.

a character or thing that suddenly enters the story…and solves a problem that had previously seemed impossible to solve

Default Inference
The intrusion achieves nothing but incredibility, and the staling of the device of the Eagles when at last they are really needed.
